ai.summary: Effingham walk (SCC) is a challenging 20.6 km circuit in the UK, starting near Effingham and looping through a mix of rural lanes, hedgerows, woodlands, and farmland. The route combines several gentle ascents with longer flat stretches and can be physically demanding.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain is varied: tarmac roads, compact paths, grassy field edges, and woodland tracks. Expect uneven ground, occasional muddy sections after rain, stiles, and some exposed sections with limited shade.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for 6–8 hours. Check weather and daylight; wear sturdy waterproof boots. Carry a map and compass (or reliable GPS), plus a charged phone. Stay on official paths; mind livestock in fields and road crossings. Bring enough water and snacks; have a means to signal for help (whistle). Let someone know your route and ETA.
recommended_gear: Gloves and a warm layer for cold weather
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of delays)
Whistle and mobile phone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for best conditions; summer offers longer daylight, while winter can be muddy and exposed; adjust gear accordingly.

seo.title: Effingham Walk (SCC) – 20.6 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Effingham Walk (SCC), a challenging 20.6 km circuit in the UK. This hard hike combines rural lanes, fields and woodland with elevation and navigation challenges. Practical safety tips and gear.
